intro: Maoutia odontophylla, commonly known as the toothed maoutia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated edges and small, clustered yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and unique characteristics, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
